Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis M I Phiffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marquis M I Phiffer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marquis M I Phiffer was found guilty of Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 3 yrs.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 yrs.
10/30/18 Crt amends JOC to reflect Def found eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program after 2 yrs of incarceration. All other conditions remain the same.

superMiscConds.notes: $500 paid from bond. Bal  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JPS & JTG.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

from Defn to Judge
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Amber Day Lucsay.  Awais Khaleel appeared for the State of Wisconsin OBO Andrea Raymond. Parties filed a stipulation and proposed order to allow defn to pursue treatment through the Substance Abuse Program immediately. Original JOC indicated defn is eligible for SUBST ABUSE PGRM after 3 years of incarceration. Argument by Atty Lucsay. State does not object to the stipulation; argument by ADA Khaleel. CT inquires whether this change will need to be an amendment of the JOC or a resentencing hearing is needed. Counsel advised procedure should be an amendment of the JOC and not to resentence defn. Defn declines to make an allocution. CT makes findings and orders amending the JOC to reflect "defn found eligible for the CHALLENGE INCRTN PRGRM and SUBST ABUSE PGRM after 2 years of incarceration". All other conditions of the sentence remain the same.

Motion to modify cash bail to signature bond.  Atty Lucsay makes arbuments.  State takes no position.  Bail amended to $500 cash and BMP participation.  All other conditions remain the same.
referral form to bail monitoring

AMEND CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jacob G., Tiffany S., or Michelle S.
- Defendant shall not be at the BP/Amoco on University Ave in Middleton, WI.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Trial Judge - Br 7
